intro: Lepidagathis kaessneri, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in high-altitude environments. The plant features dense clusters of tiny white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually arranged in a rosette pattern and are covered in fine, scale-like structures. Lepidagathis kaessneri is adapted to cold, rocky habitats and is often found in alpine meadows.
